import MethodEndpoint from "@theme/ApiExplorer/MethodEndpoint";
import ParamsDetails from "@theme/ParamsDetails";

<Heading
  as={"h1"}
  className={"openapi__heading"}
  children={"Delete tags by IDs"}
>
</Heading>

<MethodEndpoint
  method={"delete"}
  path={"/api/v1.0/tags/ids"}
  context={"endpoint"}
>
  
</MethodEndpoint>



Soft-deletes multiple tags by TagId, allowing bulk cleanup while preserving records for restore workflows.

**Prerequisites**
1. **TagId list** - Use [GET /api/v1.0/tags/query](/docs/api/tags/get-tags-by-query) to locate tags and extract `Items[].TagId`.

**Workflow Example**
1. Identify the TagId values to remove.
2. Call [DELETE /api/v1.0/tags/ids](/docs/api/tags/delete-tags-by-ids) with the TagId array.
3. Restore an individual tag later with [PUT /api/v1.0/tags/\{TagId\}/undelete](/docs/api/tags/undelete-tag).

**Minimal Required Fields**: TagId array (request body)

**Note**: This API is deprecated.

<Heading
  id={"request"}
  as={"h2"}
  className={"openapi-tabs__heading"}
  children={"Request"}
>
</Heading>

<ParamsDetails
  parameters={undefined}
>
  
</ParamsDetails>

<RequestSchema
  title={"Body"}
  body={{"required":true,"content":{"application/json":{"schema":{"type":"array","description":"List of tag IDs to delete","items":{"type":"string","format":"uuid"}},"example":["a1b2c3d4-e5f6-7890-abcd-ef1234567890","b2c3d4e5-f6a7-8901-bcde-f12345678901"]}}}}
>
  
</RequestSchema>

  id={undefined}
  label={undefined}
